apis.name: Epic FHIR APIs
apis.description: Healthcare data access via Epic FHIR R4 APIs. Access patient records, medications, allergies, and more.

examples.title: Fetch Patient Data
examples.code:
const response = await fetch('/api/epic/fhir/Patient/123');
const patient = await response.json();

examples.title: Search Medications

apis.setupInstructions: Configure Epic credentials in Settings > Epic Integration

externalIntegrations.name: Google Analytics 4
externalIntegrations.description: Track user behavior and website analytics with Google Analytics 4. Includes page views, events, and user metrics.

envVars.name: NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_ID
envVars.description: Google Analytics 4 Measurement ID (starts with G-)

setupSteps: Go to analytics.google.com and create a new GA4 property
Copy your Measurement ID (starts with G-)
The GoogleAnalytics component will be added to your layout automatically

externalIntegrations.name: Mock Analytics Service
externalIntegrations.description: A mock analytics service for testing integration injection. Mimics Google Analytics API patterns.
setupSteps: Use useMockAnalytics() hook to track events

externalIntegrations.name: Mock GA Data API
externalIntegrations.description: A complete mock implementation of the Google Analytics 4 Data API. Provides realistic report data for testing GA4 integrations without needing real credentials.

envVars.name: NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_PROPERTY_ID
envVars.description: GA4 Property ID for mock API calls

setupSteps: The Mock GA Data API is available at /api/mock-ga
Use runReport(), runRealtimeReport(), etc. to fetch mock analytics data
